title: Ticket #3678: Revisit UniquePid code in DAGMan
description: We should look at the UniquePid code in DAGMan, and see whether it really does what it's supposed to do. And, maybe more importantly, figure out whether we really need the 12 second sleep that's part of this.
remarks:
2013-Jun-05 18:27:46 by bbockelm:
Specifically, on Linux:
  • I don't see how the 12 second sleep could help/change anything since we use the process birthday.
  • Right now, we use the Unix timestamp to record the process birthday. That's wrong - what if someone changes the clock? Rather, we want to use the field that provides the birthday measured in jiffies since boot.
creator: wenger
